If you're still having trouble, you may want to consult the camera's manual or seek assistance from a professional photographer."

"It's possible that your camera is not receiving enough light to focus properly. You can try to adjust the camera's ISO settings or use a tripod to stabilize the camera and allow more time for the image to focus."

"If you're having trouble focusing on a moving subject, you can try using the camera's continuous autofocus mode. This mode will continuously adjust the focus as the subject moves, allowing you to capture clear images."
"It's possible that your camera's lens is dirty or scratched. You can try to clean the lens using a lens cleaning kit or take the camera to a professional cleaner for more thorough cleaning."
"If you're having trouble focusing on a subject that is very far away, you can try using the camera's telephoto lens. This lens will allow you to zoom in on the subject and focus on it more easily."
